---
title: WWDC 2019 Roundup - Podcast Episode
date: 2019-09-11 07:42
description: WWDC 2019 was a major year with Catalyst, Apple Watch, iCloud and of
  course SwiftUI. Therefore, I did three episodes highlighting the biggest advances.
---
WWDC 2019 was a major year with Catalyst, Apple Watch, iCloud and of
course SwiftUI. After WWDC 2019 this summer, I did [three podcast
episodes](https://www.empowerapps.show/) highlighting some of the
important new lessons we learned.

## [WWDC 2019 - Apple Watch with Gary Sabo](https://www.empowerapps.show/18)

[Gary Sabo](https://twitter.com/garysabo) of [MyndArc
LLC](https://apps.apple.com/us/developer/myndarc-llc/id979588062), has
developed a variety of sports and activity apps for the Apple Watch so
it was great to have him on to give his perspective on how the device
has evolved.

> In this episode we talk with Gary Sabo about the Apple Watch post-WWDC
> 2019. We talk about Independent Watch Apps, Swift UI and watchOS 6,
> HealthKit, Fitness apps and more.

<span class="play-btn icon-play-circle" v-show="!playing" title="Play"

## [WWDC 2019 - Swift UI with Jason Anderson](https://www.empowerapps.show/19)

[Jason Anderson](https://twitter.com/_jasonranderson) has been working
with reactive frameworks in iOS for 10 years. He brings some really
great advice on getting started with Swift UI and the MVVM pattern.

> In this episode we talk with Jason Anderson about Swift UI and
> reactive Swift post-WWDC 2019.

<span class="play-btn icon-play-circle" v-show="!playing" title="Play"
aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"></span> <span
class="pause-btn icon-pause-circle" v-show="playing" title="Pause"
aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"></span>

## [WWDC 2019 - Mac Development with Daniel Jalkut](https://www.empowerapps.show/20)

[Daniel Jalkut](https://twitter.com/danielpunkass) of [Red
Sweater](https://red-sweater.com/) and [Core
Intuition](https://coreint.org/) has been developing software for the
Mac for over 20 years. If you are interested in learning how Mac
development has changed whether it’s the App Store or the security
features added, this is great episode.

> In this episode we talk with Daniel Jalkut of Red Sweater Software
> about what’s new in Mac Development post-WWDC 2019.

<span class="play-btn icon-play-circle" v-show="!playing" title="Play"
aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"></span> <span
class="pause-btn icon-pause-circle" v-show="playing" title="Pause"
aria-hidden="true" focusable="false"></span>

}}</span> • Season {{ selectedEpisode.season }}

{{ selectedEpisode.title }}

<span class="play-btn icon-play-circle" v-show="!playing" title="Play"
